Background alt.$description: Alt background colour. Use as a contrasting background for visual interest.

Background alt shade.$description: Darker shade of the Alt background. Used to slightly shade elements such as accordions and call outs on top of the Alt background.

Background.$description: Primary background colour when using light palette

Background shade.$description: Darker shade of the light background. Used as fills for elements such as accordions and call outs on top of light backgrounds.

Border alt.$description: Border colour for form borders on all light backgrounds. Must meet contrast ratio of 3:1 across all light backgrounds

Border.$description: Decorative border colour used on light backgrounds

Primary.$description: Colour of primary actions / buttons used on a light themed container

Primary hover.$description: Hover colour for primary actions / buttons

Secondary.$description: Colour for secondary actions. Button border for secondary action buttons. Icon colour for icon actions.

Link on action.$description: Colour for text/icons on a primary action button

Accent.$description: Brand accent colour, used for key highlights and content dividers. Purely decorative and do not require an accessibility check.

Focus.$description: Focus colour should be as consistent as possible and ideally not the same as any action colour. Focus colours must meet a contrast ratio of 3:1.

Heading.$description: Heading colours within text. These should be shades of your brand colour and if posisble different from primary action and link colours so the user does not interpret them as clickable.

Text.$description: Text colours are indicated by the text icon. All text contrast must meet WCAG 2.0 Level AA conformance which means a contrast ration of 4.5:1

Lighter.$description: Lighter text used for inactive states, captions, and secondary information.

Default.$description: Default underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

Visited.$description: Visited link underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

Visited hover.$description: Hover colour for visited link underline.

Site title.$description: Colour for title of site in header component

Disabled.$description: Lighter text used for inactive states, captions, and secondary information.

Background.$description: Primary background colour when using Dark palette

Background shade.$description: Darker shade of the Primary Dark background. Used as fills for elements such as accordions and call outs on top of dark backgrounds.

Background alt.$description: Secondar background colour when using Dark palette

Background alt shade.$description: Darker shade of the Secondary Dark background. Used as fills for elements such as accordions and call outs on top of dark backgrounds.

Border.$description: Decorative border colour used on dark primary backgrounds

Border alt.$description: Border colour for form borders on all dark backgrounds. Must meet contrast ratio of 3:1 across all dark backgrounds

Primary.$description: Colour of primary actions / buttons used on a dark themed container

Primary hover.$description: Hover colour for primary actions / buttons

Secondary.$description: Colour for secondary actions. Button border for secondary action buttons. Icon colour for icon actions.

Link on action.$description: Colour for text/icons on a primary action button

Link.$description: Colour for hyperlink text when using dark palette

Visited.$description: Colour for visited links when using dark palettes

Accent.$description: Brand accent colour, used for key highlights and content dividers. Purely decorative and do not require an accessibility check.

Focus.$description: Focus colour should be as consistent as possible and ideally not the same as any action colour. Focus colours must meet a contrast ratio of 3:1.

Heading.$description: Heading colours within text. These should be shades of your brand colour and if possible different from primary action and link colours so the user does not interpret them as clickable.

Lighter.$description: Lighter text used for inactive states, captions, and secondary information.

Default.$description: Default underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

Visited.$description: Visited link underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

Visited hover.$description: Hover colour for visited link underline.

Site title.$description: Colour for title of site in header component

Disabled.$description: Lighter text used for inactive states, captions, and secondary information.
